```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

Table below lists all the symbols which are used by TrenchR functions

#Parameters
| Symbol        | Description           |   |
| ------------- |:----------------------------------------------------:| ---------------------:|
|$A$ | surface or cross-sectional area ($m^2$) |  |
| $a$ | radius of the earth ($m$): acceleration in ($ms^{-2}$); absorptance (decimal fraction); altitude angle of the sun (degrees)(subscripts: s, for normal to a slope; c ,for the axis of a cylinder); albedo (subscript s for surface)|   |
|$Acondfact$| proportion of the animal surface area that is in contact with the ground||
|$Agradfact$| proportion of the animal projected area exposed to radiation from the ground||
|$abs$| absorptivity (of grasshopper) to solar radiation (proportion) ||
|air_pressure| air pressure (kPa) ||
|$aran$| scale performance value? if aran=0, no scaling; if aran=1, include a thermodynamic effect on mean performance. ||
|$breadth$| breadth of the thermal performance curve ||
|$breadth$| breadth of the thermal performance curve ||
|$c_a$ |	specific heat of air ($J kg^{-1}$ &deg;$K^{-1}$). | |
|$c_p$ |	specific heat at constant pressure ($J kg^{-1}$ &deg;$C^{-1}$). | |
|$c_{so}$ |	soil specific heat capacity ($J kg^{-1}$ &deg;$K^{-1}$). | |
|$CTmin$| critical thermal minima (&deg;$C$), the lower temperature limit for performance ||
|$CTmax$| critical thermal maxima (&deg;$C$), the lower temperature limit for performance ||
|$D$|	characteristic dimension ($m$); thoractic diameter ($cm$) ||
|$d$|	thickness of material ($m$) (subscript f for fat); diameter of a cylinder ($m$).||
|$day$ or $doy$| day of year ||
|$deg$| angle (degrees) ||
|$depth$|	depth ($cm$).||
|$ef$| enhancement factor, used to adjust H to field conditions.||
|$elev$| elevation of a site above mean sea level ($m$).||
|$e$|	water vapor pressure ($N m^{-2}, mbar$) (subscripts: a, of the air,s, at saturation).||
|$F$| View factor (dimensionless) (subscripts: a, atmospheric radiation; d, between lizard and diffuse solar radiation; g, ground thermal radiation; r, beteen lizard and reflected solar radiation ) ||
|$g_a$| a shape factor on soil particles. ||
|$H$|	solar radiation ($W m^{-2}$) (subscripts: sdir, for direct flux; sdif, for diffuse flux).||
|$H_L$ or $H$|	Convective heat transfer coefficient ($W m^{-2}$ &deg;$C^{-1}$ or $W m^{-2}$ &deg;$K^{-1}$).||
|$Hr$| mean month relative humidity (percentage) ||
|$h$|	height ($m$); length of a cylinder ($m$); relative humidity (decimal fraction); Planck's constant ($J s$); hour angle (rad).||
|$hour$| hour (0-24) ||
|$K$|	thermal conductance ($W m^{-2}$ &deg;$C^{-1}$) (subscripts f, fur; g, substrate; s, skin; sf, skin and fur; o, overall heat conductance for an animal; c, surface boundary layer for convection; so, soil).||
|$k$| von Karman's constant, k~0.41 ||
|k_so| soil thermal conductivity ($W m^{-1}$ &deg;$K^{-1}$) ||
|$K_t$ or $kt$| clearness index, the ratio of the global solar radiation measured at the surface to the total solar radiation at the top of the atmosphere (dimensionless) ||
|$L$| the Monin-Obukhov length, a measure of the instability of heat flow.||
|$l$ or $L$| length ($m$) ||
|$lon$| longitude (degrees) ||
|$lat$| latitude (degrees) ||
|$LDT$| Lower developmental threshold (&deg;$C$)  ||
|$lw$| Downward flux of near-infrared radiation (W/m^2) ||
|$m$|	mass ($kg$ or $g$); atomic mass ($kg$ or $g$); air mass (dimensionless).||
|$P$| monthly precipitation ($mm$) ||
|$psa$| proportion surface exposed (dimensionless) (subscripts: air, for exposed to air, ref, for exposed to ground; dir, to sky or enclosure; g, substrate) ||
|$Qabs$| Solar and thermal radiation absorbed ($W$) ||
|$Qemit$| Thermal radiation emitted ($W$) ||
|$Qconv$| Energy exchange due to convection; Energy exchange between an animal and the air ($W$) ||
|$Qcond$| Energy exchange due to conduction; Energy exchange between an animal and the surface ($W$) ||
|$Qmet$| Energy emitted due to metabolism ($W$) ||
|$Qevap$| Energy emitted due to evaporative water loss ($W$) ||
|$r$|	reflectance (decimal fraction) (subscripts: g, of ground or lower leaf surface; S, to direct sunlight; s, to skylight); diffusion resistance to water vapor ($s m^{-1}$) (subscripts: b, boundary layer; c, cuticular; i, internal or intercellular; $l FIX$, leaf internal; m, mesophyll; s, stomatal); resistance to heat flow ($s m^{-1}$) (subscripts: h, ha, boundary layer; j, diffusion resistance to molecular species j; radius ($m$) (subscripts: b, of inside body wall of animal; r, of outer surface of animal).||
|$rad$| angle (radians) ||
|$raz$| solar azimuth angle (degrees) ||
|$S$|	amount of sunlight incident upon the earth's surface ($W m{-2}$) (subscripts: c, on a cylinder; cv, on a vertical cylinder; ch, on a horizontal cylinder; dir, direct solar radiation; dif, diffuse solar radiation; h, on a horizontal surface; ref, reflected solar radiation; $\lambda$, mono-chromatic); entropy ($J mole^{-1} C^{-1}$); equivalent network resistances ($s m^{-1}$); (subscript $\lambda$, monochromatic).||
|$shade$| whether soil temperature is calculated in the shade or not ||
|$shift$| mode of the thermal performance curve ||
|$skew$| skewness of the thermal performance curve ||
|$sol.elev$| solar elevation angles in degrees ||
|$solrad$| solar radiation in $W m^{-2}$ per day ||
|$SSA$|solar absorbtivity of soil surface as a fraction ||
|$svl$| lizard snout vent length ($mm$) ||
|$t$| time ($hr$ or $s$) (subscripts: n, time of minimum temprature; s, sunrise; r, sunset; x, time of maximum temperature) ||
|$T$| temperature (&deg;$C$) ||
|$Ta$ or $T_a$|	air temperature ($C^{\circ}$ or $K$ or $F^{\circ}$) ||
|$Tdewpoint$|	dewpoint temperature (&deg;$C$)||
|$Tg$ or $T_g$| surface temperature in the sun (&deg;$C$) (subscript sh for temperature in the shade) ||
|$Ts$ or $T_s$| surface temperature (&deg;$C$) ||
|$T_{max}$| Maximum temperature of the day(&deg;$C$) ||
|$T_{min}$| Minimum temperature of the day (&deg;$C$) ||
|$Tg_{max}$| Maximum soil surface temperature of the day(&deg;$C$) ||
|$Tg_{min}$| Minimum soil surface temperature of the day (&deg;$C$) ||
|$Topt$| thermal optima, the temperature at which peak performance occurs (&deg;$C$) ||
|$Tsoil0$| initial soil temperature (&deg;$C$) ||
|$tolerance$| maximal breath (&deg;$C$) of the thermal performance curve ||
|$u$| wind speed ($m/s$) (subscripts: r, reference height or heights)||
|$UDT$| Upper developmental threshold (&deg;$C$)  || 
|$V$|	velocity ($m s^{-1}$); volume ($m^{3}$) (subscript w, partial molar); photopic efficiency (decimal fraction).||
|water_content| percent water content (percent) ||
|$x$| vector of volume fractions of soil constituents (e.g., clay, quartz, minerals other than quartz, organic matter, water, air). ||
|$z$| distance, or height above a surface ($m$) (subscript r for reference height); zenith angle (degrees)||
|$zr$| reference height ($m$) ||
|$z0$| roughness height ($m$) ||

##Greek Symbols
| Symbol        | Description           |   |
| ------------- |:----------------------------------------------------:| ---------------------:|
|$\alpha$|	initial slope of photosynthesis versus light intensity curve ($mmoles E^{-1}$); angle (rad or degrees); azimuth angle of the sun (degrees); solar absorptivity (proportion) (subscripts: L, lizard thermal absorptivity; S, lizard solar absorptivity ); time difference between time of maximum temperature and noon ($hr$) ||
|$\beta$| slope angle, direction of normal from horizontal (degrees); coefficient of volumetric thermal expansion (°C-'); competitive inhibition factor (dimensionless); proportionality coefficient for Mie scattering; Bowen's ratio, C/XE; psychrome¬ter constant (m °C-'); parameter (exponent) for Mie scattering; time difference between time of maximum temperature and sunrise ($hr$)||
|$\delta$|	thoracic fur thickness ($mm$)||
|$\epsilon$| emissivity (decimal fraction) (subscripts: a, of atmosphere; s, surface emissivity of lizards). angle (rad degree-1); angle between axis of a cylinder and direction of the sun's rays; equivalent temperature (°C).;  thermal absorptivity as a fraction (subscript so, soil) ||
|$\gamma$| decay parameter for rate of time change from sunset to time of minimum temperature ||
|$\lambda$| vector of the thermal conductivities (W m^-1 K^-1) of the soil constituents.||
|$\mu$| dynamic viscosity (mol s^{-1}m^{-1}).||
|$\nu$| kinematic viscosity coefficient (m2 s-1).||
|$\psi$| solar zenith angle (degrees).||
|$\rho$|	density ($kg m^{-3}$) (subscripts: a, of dry air; j, of molecular species; o, of standard air; w, of water vapor; so, soil); radius of a cylinder (m); reflectivity (decimal fraction) (subscript S for surface albedo).||
|$\tau$|	atmospheric transmissivity (proportion) (subscripts: d, to diffuse radiation; t, to total radiation); thermal time constant ($s$ or $hr$) (superscript a, apparent).||
|$\theta$| angle between the solar beam and the longitudinal axis in degrees.||

##Dimensionless Groups
| Symbol        | Description           |   |
| ------------- |:----------------------------------------------------:| ---------------------:|
|$Gr$|	Grashof number||
|$Nu$|	Nusselt number||
|$Re$|	Reynolds number||
